SEARCH: Enter your postal code or the name of your area

CPAS_EXPLAIN.centers_text: The main CPAS office of a given commune. What it does: receives applications, issues official decisions on eligibility, arranges payments, housing/health-insurance support, and provides certificates. It is the legal point of reference and the primary address for your commune.
CPAS_EXPLAIN.antennas_text: Neighborhood intake points of the same CPAS, closer to where you live (local/quarter offices). What they do: first reception, guidance, document collection, social assessment, and follow-up. The formal decision is still taken by your communeâ€™s CPAS center.

WHAT_IS_CPAS: The CPAS/OCMW (Public Center for Social Welfare) is a municipal service in Belgium that supports people in need. It provides social, financial, medical, or material assistance depending on the individual's situation. On this page, you can find the CPAS/OCMW responsible for your area by using the postal code or the street where you live.
WHAT_IS_ACTIRIS: Actiris is the public employment service for the Brusselsâ€‘Capital Region. It supports jobseekers with registration, job matching, training, career guidance and employer programmes. On this page you can find your local Actiris office by commune/postcode or by the street where you live.
WHAT_IS_VDAB: VDAB (Flemish Service for Employment and Vocational Training) is the official employment service for Flanders and Dutchâ€‘speaking residents of Brussels. It offers jobs, training, career advice and reskilling programmes. On this page you can find the appropriate VDAB office by region using your postcode or the street where you live.

CONTACTS_PAGE.META_TITLE: Important contacts in Belgium â€” emergency services, social aid, jobs, healthcare
CONTACTS_PAGE.META_DESCRIPTION: Emergency numbers 112/101/1733, hotlines 1712/116000, CPAS/OCMW, Red Cross, Actiris/VDAB/FOREM, and mutualities. Click to call or open the website.
CONTACTS_PAGE.LEAD: All key phone numbers and official websites in one place: emergency services, social aid, employment, and healthcare. Click to call or visit the relevant serviceâ€™s website.

NEW_INCOMER.title: Step-by-step Guide for Newcomers in Belgium
NEW_INCOMER.description: This guide will help you understand what to do when you arrive in Belgium.

STEP_1.title: Obtain Protection in Belgium
STEP_1.description: Go to the registration centre in Brussels at Rue Belliard 68, 1000 Brussels. The centre is open from Monday to Friday, with registration starting at 08:30. The number of places is limited, so it is recommended to arrive early in the morning. Here you can apply for temporary protection or refugee status.

STEP_2.title: Find Housing or Stay in Refugee Camp
STEP_2.description: Look for temporary or permanent accommodation. If you have no housing, you may be assigned to a refugee reception centre.

STEP_3.title: Register at the Commune
STEP_3.description: Go to your local commune to register your address, get Annex 15, and apply for the A card.

STEP_4.title: Register at CPAS/OCMW
STEP_4.description: Visit your local CPAS/OCMW to apply for social assistance.

STEP_5.title: Register with Employment Office (Actiris/VDAB)
STEP_5.description: Register at Actiris or VDAB depending on your region to look for work or get jobseeker status.

STEP_6.title: Apply for Social Benefits
STEP_6.description: Once registered at the Commune and CPAS/OCMW, you can apply for social benefits if eligible.

STEP_7.title: Start Language Courses
STEP_7.description: Many regions offer free French or Dutch language courses for migrants.

TEMP_PROTECTION.TITLE: Temporary Protection (TP) in Belgium: Quick Guide

REGISTRATION.TEXT: All matters are handled at the single registration center IBZ in Brussels.
REGISTRATION.TIME: Time: It is recommended to arrive before 08:00. There is a separate queue for Ukrainians.

DOCUMENTS.TITLE: What documents should you prepare?
DOCUMENTS.GOAL: The main goal is to prove that you were living in Ukraine as of 24.02.2022.
DOCUMENTS.PROOF: Proof of residence: Bank statements, work/medical certificates, documents from 'Diia', court decisions.
DOCUMENTS.IMPORTANT: Important: A certificate from the State Border Guard Service about crossing the border (can be ordered online) significantly simplifies the procedure.

INTERVIEW.TITLE: Interview
INTERVIEW.TEXT: Communication with the inspector through an interpreter (you can choose Ukrainian or Russian).

WAITING.TITLE: Waiting
WAITING.TEXT: The decision can be given immediately (document with photo) or sent by mail within 30 days to the address you provided.

HOUSING.TITLE: Housing and finances
HOUSING.BUDGET: Budget: Have a reserve of funds for the first 2-3 months of living (food, transport), as the processing of social benefits may take time.
HOUSING.ADDRESS: Address: To receive Card A, a physical address is mandatory (with friends or in social housing) where the police can check you.

RESULT.TITLE: Result
RESULT.ANNEX15: Temporary document that you receive after approval. With it, you go to the local commune (city hall) at your future place of residence.
RESULT.CARD_A: Plastic residence permit that gives the right to work and access to the social system.

APP_INFO.TITLE: Support for Migrants in Belgium
APP_INFO.DESCRIPTION: This application helps migrants in Belgium navigate local services such as CPAS/OCMW, Actiris, and VDAB. Thanks to multilingual support, it simplifies communication with public authorities and helps understand official procedures.

FEATURES.CPAS_SEARCH: Search CPAS/OCMW centers by city and region, with address and contact info.
FEATURES.MULTILANG: Multilingual support for Ukrainian, English, Turkish, French, and Dutch.
FEATURES.CARRIERS: Find reliable carriers for transporting goods between Ukraine and Belgium.
FEATURES.TRANSLATORS: Connect with professional translators for documents and official procedures.
FEATURES.LANGUAGE_TUTORS: Find language tutors to learn French or Dutch and integrate faster.
FEATURES.PRIVACY: No personal data is stored. Your queries are secure and anonymous.

NEWCOMER.TITLE: I just arrived in Belgium!
NEWCOMER.DESCRIPTION: You've just arrived and don't know what to do? We've prepared a step-by-step guide.

cpas_list_title: This guide helps you prepare the right documents, find your local CPAS/OCMW, and book your first appointment. Clear, actionable steps explain what to bring, how to contact CPAS/OCMW, typical decision timelines, and what happens next. Start hereâ€”everything you need is in one place.

step_1.title: PrÃ©parer les documents
step_1.description: Annexe 15, passeport ou carte dâ€™identitÃ©, preuve dâ€™adresse (contrat de bail, inscription ou attestation de lâ€™hÃ©bergeur), relevÃ©s bancaires (1â€“3 derniers mois), autres documents (preuve de revenus, certificats mÃ©dicaux le cas Ã©chÃ©ant).

step_2.title: Choisir le CPAS/OCMW de votre domicile
step_2.description: Trouvez le CPAS/OCMW de votre commune (par code postal ou adresse).

step_3.title: Premier contact
step_3.description: TÃ©lÃ©phonez ou envoyez un e-mail. Certains CPAS/OCMW proposent un formulaire de prise de rendez-vous en ligne.

step_4.title: Fixer un rendez-vous
step_4.description: Un rendez-vous avec un(e) assistant(e) social(e) vous sera proposÃ©. Un prÃ©-dÃ©pistage tÃ©lÃ©phonique peut avoir lieu.

step_5.title: Entretien
step_5.description: Apportez tous les documents. DÃ©crivez votre situation : logement, revenus, besoins. Lâ€™agent ouvre votre dossier.

step_6.title: Attente de la dÃ©cision
step_6.description: Le CPAS/OCMW analyse votre dossier (gÃ©nÃ©ralement 7 Ã  30 jours). Il peut vous convoquer Ã  un entretien supplÃ©mentaire ou demander des piÃ¨ces complÃ©mentaires.

step_7.title: Obtention de lâ€™aide
step_7.description: Si avis favorable : aide sociale, soutien au logement, assurance maladie ou cours. En cas de refus â€” possibilitÃ© dâ€™introduire un recours.

LETTER_FORM.LETTER_READY: Your letter is ready to copy

LETTER_STEPPER.TITLE: Compose your letter
LETTER_STEPPER.DESCRIPTION: Enter your details using the Latin alphabetâ€”as in your passport (Aâ€“Z). When youâ€™re done, you can copy the generated letter or, if your mail app is set up, open it with everything preâ€‘filled. Tip: review the preview on the last step before sending.
LETTER_STEPPER.ACTIRIS_TAB_EXPLANATION: First contact: please request an appointment via the Actiris website (registration/re-registration) or visit a local office in person. On this page, you can generate a letter if you already have a social worker/case manager. If not, please use the link below.

HOUSE_SEARCH.title: Housing rental
HOUSE_SEARCH.catch_desc: For legalization in Belgium, it is mandatory to have housing. This may be a rented apartment, a room, or social housing.
HOUSE_SEARCH.websites_desc: You can independently search for housing using popular platforms to find apartments, studios, or houses.
HOUSE_SEARCH.agencies_desc: You can contact real estate agents who will help you find options and guide you through the rental process.
HOUSE_SEARCH.intermediaries_desc: You can turn to intermediaries if you do not have confirmed income or if you only have a residence permit under Â§24.

websites.title: Real estate websites
websites.description: You can search for housing independently using popular platforms to find apartments, studios, or houses.

items.name: Immoweb
items.short_desc: The largest real estate portal in Belgium with extensive filters.

items.name: Zimmo
items.short_desc: Popular alternative to Immoweb with fresh listings.

items.name: Logic-Immo
items.short_desc: Well-known platform with a wide range of offers.

items.name: Immoscoop
items.short_desc: Listings from agencies before they appear on major portals.

items.name: Facebook Marketplace
items.short_desc: Many groups where private landlords post directly.

agencies.title: Real estate agencies
agencies.description: You can contact agencies for professional support in renting housing.

items.name: ERA
items.short_desc: National network of agencies with a large database.

items.name: Century21
items.short_desc: International real estate network present in all major cities.

items.name: Trevi
items.short_desc: Well-established agency with offices across Belgium.

items.name: We Invest
items.short_desc: Modern agency with online tools, strong presence in Brussels.

items.name: Victoire Properties
items.short_desc: Agency specialized in Brussels and premium housing.

CPAS_HERO.TITLE: CPAS/OCMW Support
CPAS_HERO.CTA_TEXT: Need help from CPAS/OCMW? Visit the official resources below.

ACTIRIS_HERO.TITLE: Employment Support
ACTIRIS_HERO.CTA_TEXT: Looking for work in Belgium? Visit official employment services.

CARRIERS_HERO.TITLE: Transport & Logistics
CARRIERS_HERO.DESCRIPTION: Find reliable carriers for transporting goods and people between Ukraine and Belgium. We connect you with verified transport companies offering safe and affordable services.
CARRIERS_HERO.SOON_TEXT: We are working on a platform to connect migrants with trusted carriers. Soon you will be able to find and book transport services between Ukraine and Belgium.
CARRIERS_HERO.INFO_TEXT: Our transport service will help you find reliable carriers for moving between Ukraine and Belgium, whether you need to transport personal belongings, goods, or travel yourself.

TUTORS_HERO.TITLE: Language Learning
TUTORS_HERO.DESCRIPTION: Find professional language tutors to learn French or Dutch. Improve your language skills to better integrate into Belgian society and access more opportunities.
TUTORS_HERO.SOON_TEXT: We are building a platform to connect you with experienced language tutors. Soon you will be able to find teachers for French and Dutch lessons, both online and in-person.
TUTORS_HERO.INFO_TEXT: Our language learning service will help you find qualified tutors for French and Dutch, enabling faster integration and better access to opportunities in Belgium.

UKR_CHANNELS_HERO.TITLE: ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¦ Ukrainian Communication Channels in Belgium
UKR_CHANNELS_HERO.DESCRIPTION: Find Ukrainian communities, chats and channels on Telegram, Facebook, WhatsApp and Viber. Connect with fellow Ukrainians, get support and up-to-date information about life in Belgium.
UKR_CHANNELS_HERO.SOON_TEXT: We are collecting active Ukrainian channels and communities in Belgium. Soon you will be able to find chats for communication, getting help and sharing information with other Ukrainians.
UKR_CHANNELS_HERO.INFO_TEXT: Our service will help you find Ukrainian communities in Belgium for communication, getting support and sharing useful information about life in the country.

INTRO.TITLE: 1. Introduction
INTRO.TEXT: {{appName}} is an informational tool for newcomers in Belgium. Data is compiled from official public sources and may change. We recommend verifying accuracy on government websites.

INFO_NATURE.TITLE: 2. Informational nature
INFO_NATURE.TEXT: The information provided is for guidance only and does not constitute legal or official advice. For decisions, consult competent authorities (CPAS/OCMW, Actiris, VDAB, communes, etc.).

DATA.TITLE: 3. Data collection and processing
DATA.TEXT: The app does not collect, store, or process usersâ€™ personal data. If contact forms or analytics are added in the future, we will update this policy and provide appropriate notices.

LIABILITY.TITLE: 4. Limitation of liability
LIABILITY.TEXT: We strive to keep information up to date, but do not guarantee completeness or accuracy. The developers are not liable for any consequences related to the use of the information or changes in laws/policies.

LINKS.TITLE: 5. External links
LINKS.TEXT: The app may include links to third-party resources. We do not control their content and cannot be responsible for the accuracy or timeliness of information on those sites.

CHANGES.TITLE: 6. Changes to this policy
CHANGES.TEXT: This policy may be updated periodically. We recommend checking this page from time to time to stay informed about the latest changes.

RIGHTS.TITLE: 7. Your rights
RIGHTS.TEXT: You have rights under applicable data protection law to access, rectify, erase, restrict processing, object to processing, and data portability. To exercise these rights, contact the privacy team via the in-app form or the official contact channels.

COOKIES.TITLE: 8. Cookies and tracking
COOKIES.TEXT: We use cookies to improve your experience. Some cookies are essential for site functionality. You can manage non-essential cookies in your browser settings.

UPDATES.TITLE: 9. Updates to this policy
UPDATES.TEXT: We may update this privacy policy from time to time. Changes will be reflected on this page. Check back periodically.

FEEDBACK.DIALOG_SUBTITLE: We'd love to hear from you. Fill out the form below and we'll get back to you as soon as possible.
FEEDBACK.NAME_MINLENGTH: Name must be at least 2 characters
FEEDBACK.MESSAGE_PLACEHOLDER: Tell us more about your services or how we can help you...
FEEDBACK.MESSAGE_MINLENGTH: Message must be at least 10 characters
FEEDBACK.SUCCESS_MESSAGE: Your message has been sent successfully! We will contact you soon.
FEEDBACK.ERROR_MESSAGE: Failed to send message. Please try again later.
